text.0: send unto us a good and happy mind.
text.1: worship agni youthfullest of gods resistless friend of laws.
text.2: under whose guard and heavenly light the spotted seek the mothers breast.
text.3: whom with their mouth they magnify bannered with flame and homed in light.
text.4: he glitters with his row of teeth.
text.5: kind furtherer of men he comes when he hath reached the ends of heaven.
text.6: sage giving splendour to the clouds.
text.7: to taste mans offerings he the strong hath risen erect at sacrifice.
text.9: here are oblation worship rest rapidly comes his furtherance.
text.10: to swordarmed agni come the gods.
text.11: with service for chief bliss i seek the lord of sacrifice agni whom.
text.12: they call the living son of cloud.
text.13: blest evermore be all the men who come from us who magnify.
text.15: the path he treads is black and white and red and striped and brown crimson and glorious.
text.16: his sire begat him bright with hues of gold.
text.17: thus with his thoughts o son of strength o agni hath vimada accordant with the immortals.
text.18: offered thee hymns soliciting thy favour thou hast brought all food strength a prosperous dwelling.
